definition[0]: to keep criticizing someone in an unkind way
example[0]: Why is he always getting at me?
example[1]: He felt he was being got at by the other students.
definition[1]: to be trying to say something in a way that is difficult for other people to understand
example[2]: What are you getting at, Helen?
example[3]: Do you see the point Iâ€™m getting at?
definition[2]: to be able to reach something
example[4]: We had to move the washing machine out to get at the wiring behind it.
definition[3]: to discover information, especially the truth about a situation
example[5]: I was determined to get at the truth.
definition[4]: to use threats to influence the decision of people who are involved in a court case
example[6]: Do you think some of the jury have been got at?
